frameDefinitions: A stretch of linguistic discourse or a Text that a Communicator produces has a Topic that it is about.
In this frame either a Stimulus brings about a particular emotion or experience in the Experiencer or  saliently fails to bring about a particular experience.
A State_of_affairs is generally, or with regard to a particular Feature, representative of its class, which may be narrowed to a specific Comparison_set.
In this frame, an Entity or Behavior is suspicious or otherwise subject to question.
A Speaker makes a commitment to an Addressee to carry out some future action.
A Stimulus serves to bring about an emotion of mental stimulation in an Experiencer.
frameExamples: The Elan truly is an <t>unusual</t> car; the first and only Lotus with a front engined/front wheel drive layout, and the first new Lotus to be introduced since 1975.
We found some <t>suspicious</t> checks lying on his desk.
You <t>promised</t> me you'd come to my graduation.
You will not easily find a more <t>absorbing</t> box-set of piano discs.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Topic</fen> is what a <fen>Text</fen> is about.
A set of propositions that is coherent in being about a <fen>Topic</fen>
The <fen>Communicator</fen> is the person who has produced a <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> produces <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the object or event which brings about the emotion in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The state of affairs which is evaluated with regard to whether it exhibits the essential characteristics of a Comparison_set.
A property of the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> wherein it differs or is similar to members of a <fen>Comparison_set</fen>.
The <fen>Behavior</fen> is the state of affairs or action of the social actor that is regarded as susipcious.
An individual that is suspected of wrongdoing because of the <fen>Behavior</fen>.
The <fen>Entity</fen> metonymically stands in for a <fen>Behavior</fen> that saliently involves the <fen>Entity</fen>.

The Speaker is the person who commits him/herself to do something.  Speaker is usually the External Argument of predicative uses of the target or the Genitive modifier of a noun: <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> made a <t>promise</t> to me. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> <t>promised</t> me she would cook dinner. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo's</fex> <t>promise</t> to cook dinner came to nothing.

The Speaker's commitment can be made to an Addressee.  With those words which allow this frame element to be expressed, Addressee usually occurs as a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment> or the (Indirect) Object of verbs: Kim made a <t>promise</t> <fex name='Addressee'>to me</fex>. Kim <t>promised</t> <fex name='Addressee'>me</fex> that everything would be okay.

An expression of the commitment made by the Speaker expresses the frame element Message.  Message is expressed as a finite or non-finite clausal Complement or an NP Object: I <t>swore</t> <fex name='Message'>that I would never make the same mistake again</fex>. The owner finally <t>consented</t> <fex name='Message'>to sell the business</fex>. They <t>threatened</t> <fex name='Message'>revenge</fex>.
Topic expressions are not very frequent in this frame. They can occur with noun targets. Jo made endless <t>promises</t> <fex name='Topic'>about working harder at school</fex>.

As with other frames in the Communication domain, the <t>Medium</t> of communication may be expressed. Medium is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the Message. Bob <t>threatened</t> the workers <fex name='Medium'>in Spanish</fex>.
The time period during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen>  can be described as having said emotion.
listRoleExamples: In his book, <fex>Smithers</fex> discusses cotton production.
However I have always loved having an unusual <fex>name</fex> and I think it's a beautiful name. .
David Hasselhoff's daughters are normal <fex>in every way</fex>.

The chancellor <fex>yesterday</fex> promised to increase defence spending in real terms next
year.
The july framework has reaffirmed what was promised <fex>at Doha</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the last four or five months
